Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the $$
Reviews.Author: JJSebastian
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 of these to monitor a farm for a friend of ours. They all work fine in temperatures from 20-90 Degrees F, and dusty dirty conditions.The software runs in internet explorer as an active-x so the cameras be used with standard web-cam type software. Well I couldn't figure out how anyway.Using IE just adds to the memory load and reduces the reliability of the system. Also the Active-X and Internet explorer combination gets to be a real CPU hog when running 4 cameras with motion detect on, so use a decent PC if that is your plan. The software has a bunch of features, but also is buggy sometimes, which is one more reason I would love to use stand alone web-cam software....The night vision is good for close monitoring, as is the lens of the cameras, but far away isn't great so don't think your going to make out a face from 50' away.Bottom-line: They do what they say, are inexpensive and they have been out in a barn for 6 months running with no problems other than needing to reboot the PC every few days...

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but buggy software
Reviews.Author: Sandy Coyne
Reviews.Content: The camera is excellent. All the features work as advertized on the camera side. Looking at the front, the six IR LEDs don't look like much, but they really do let you see the far side of a large room in the dark. Wireless works nicely.The web interface and ActiveX control are terrible. The administrative config menus are buggy and slow, but eventually they get the job done. The worst thing for me is that sound in the ActiveX control doesn't work properly with IE9 on Windows 7 (64). So for me, the camera has no audio in either direction. I ended up using third-party software rather than stick with the buggy built-in web interface, but as far as I can see, Foscam only supports sound through their own proprietary ActiveX control and none of the third-party tools support their custom sound interface.Bottom line: If all your PCs are old, or if you don't care about audio, then you'll love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good value but not as reliable as Foscam FI8918W
Reviews.Author: RL
Reviews.Content: I have 4 FI8918W and 2 of these FI8909W units.  The 4 FI8918W all work well for over a year and I never had issues with transmission distance or reliability.Of the 2 FI8909W cams, one of them works reliably but the other developed transmission issues and locks-up after a period of a week.  I think I traced the lock-up to motion detection.  Initially within the first 6 months of use I never had any issues using the same setting/location and motion detection activity; however recently, I've either had to unplug the unit or turn off motion detection to have it work "reliably".  Unplugging the unit essentially rebooting the camera fixes the issue but if motion detection is left on, it will stop working after 3-4 days (photos/motion are being triggered and emails sent during this timeframe)and then I'll have to reboot by unplugging the unit.  So I've finally decided to turn off motion detection and after 1 week of use it hasn't locked up yet.If I didn't have a need for a thinner profile camera, I'd only purchase the FI8918W cameras. But at least my other FI8909W works reliably--and it has been transmitting over a greater distance and through walls.

Reviews.Title: OK for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Quick background: I've used various cameras, both IP, USB, and WIFI over the years in hodge podge configurations to keep an eye on my property. None have worked very well for very long for various reasons. USB cameras typically require either a lengthy USB cable or a small and portable machine in the area you are going to be recording. This of course also means a power outlet is taken up and the space to house the machine. This is my last purchase in the hodge podge area. I had high hopes for this cam after reading the reviews but it just hasn't worked the way I had hoped.I purchased this camera in an attempt to find something that would perform better than the Logitech WiLife system I got in closeout, this gave constant connection drops via the ethernet over home wiring setup. The Foscam I8909W camera has good night vision but no way to turn off the LEDS. The power indicator and all the LEds are positioned on the front of the camera so if you want to point it outside the thing will blind itself. That is to be expected, though, since it IS a night camera. However, the power indicator and data transmit lights should be able to be turned off. Electrical tape does take care of this issue.Maybe this is just the camera I received but I can't get it to maintain a connection for anything. I have it pointed out a front window and constantly the connection drops. If I try to connect directly to the camera via IP I get extremely sluggish response times. Changing the resolution or FPS does not seem to help. It seems to have less issue when connected directly to my router but one would think the wifi would be able to handle the data being transmitted. The camera and router are no more than 25 feet apart with out any actual obstacles or walls in between the two. I have very few WAP's near me and the channel I'm on is only used by me so I don't think it has anything to do with interference.The cam does connect very easily to blueiris which I use for my recording system so it has that going for it.The focus for the camera is decent for it's price point. You aren't going to get super clear pictures or read license plates 30 feet away but if you just want to know if someone/thing has been into your yard or keep an eye on the family pet then this is fine for that.I'd say if you are thinking about this one then spend a bit more and get the newer PTZ camera with 720p output on it. Or simply take the plunge and get a Dahua IP Cam and go for POE (power over ethernet) Sadly, I got this one in the hopes of it working for my needed application of a thin camera in a tight space but it just doesn't seem to work for that. I may see about returning it or doing an RMA since it won't stay connected.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8909W
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Not my first Foscam. I already have a FI8918W and a FI8908W and I bought this one because I needed a stationary camera that performed reasonably well in low light situations. The IR lights are good enough for the area I need to cover, its lights are stronger than my Asante Voyager I. I'm not sure if I like how the IR lights come on automatically and how I can't turn them off (like how the FI8908W does).I Like:-the picture quality is on par with the other Foscams I have (There is a tiny bit longer delay in transmiting the image over my other Foscams)I Don't Like:-The antenna is ridged (L-shaped only), my FI8918W antenna can change directions -The power light on the face of the camera can't be turned off (and the power supply also has a light on it too)I have the video working fine, now I just need to figure out the audio. The volume is very low on my desktop computers, strangely the audio is louder on my android phone. And I haven't gotten the mic to work yet.

Reviews.Title: not a fan
Reviews.Author: Sandra D Evans
Reviews.Content: wasn't able to get them to stay connected. I got several, as I needed them in multiple locations. But, I returned every one.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive pet monitor for my iPad
Reviews.Author: FreeMoose
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these ip cams to keep an eye on my birds within my internal network.  I primarily use my iPad and avoided installation disk by using free iPad/iphone apps.  If you are interested in doing the same, do the following: 1) Connect the antenna, power adapter and network cable to the device.  2) Plug the power adapter in the wall and connect the network cable to your router and wait for the green light to come on and blink.  3) Run a free network analyzer app like "Fing" and note the new device ip address on the map.  It will probably say something like "EchoStar Global".  4) Use your web browser and type in the local ip address found with Fing.  It will be something like 192.168.10.104.  5) The camera menu should appear and you should log in using the Server Push option (non-windows). Most of these devices are default to "admin" with no password. If successful, you should see live video using the Live Video option.  6) Set up user info (user name and password) and your wireless info (SSID, etc.) through the device management menu options.  7) Disconnect the network cable from the router. The ip camera should pick up your network in a minute.  8) Use Fing again to find the wireless ip address.  It will be listed with a new name like "B-Link Electronic" and may have an address with a new three digit extension (like 192.168.10.105).  9) Enter that address in your web browser or set up a webcam viewer using a free app like "Netcamviewer".  Now, you're ready to view your camera on your internal network for monitoring pets, kids, etc.The camera is fairly straight forward.  The focus is manually controlled via a lens focusing ring. The firmware supports WEP, WPA and WPA2.  You can turn off the network light and control the resolution (320 vice 640 image size). It's got a fixed mounting holder and comes with wall screws.  The mount uses a standard 1/4-20 threaded connector to hold the ip camera.  Overall, I'm fairly happy with it so far and would purchase another.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: azcat2tx
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to set up even with the clunky interface. Once it is up and running it is great. We have it set up to view on our iPhones, so we do not really have any issues with the browser viewing.The only issue i had with this camera was aesthetic. The camera is white (at least for the model number ending in W). Nowhere did it mention unit color when i bought it, and all the pictures showed a black camera. This actually worked out better for us, since we wanted it to look a little hidden. Now it looks like it is a part of our security system.If you are using it just as a nanny cam, and want to see what is going on in the room it is execellent. I don't recommend it if you need to be able to see close-up and zoom. Then you will need to spend a lot more money since these do not zoom.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother if you use a browser other than IE
Reviews.Author: David Miller
Reviews.Content: We bought this unit to try and diagnose a pet behavior issue. The ability to hear and speak through the unit was critical to this use. After working through the installation (which was easy), we couldn't find anywhere to activate the 2-way audio and none of the screens we were seeing matched the screens in the manual.Noticing there were some sections in the manual labeled "(Internet Explorer)" I opened the camera up in IE and there was the audio functionality. A message to the company on their suppoort forums confirms their cameras do not have full functionality unless you use IE. As near as I can tell, managing multiple cameras and recording is also IE-only.So unless you use IE, avoid this camera.Product rated 1 star because it is not functional in the majority of browsers used and because the product description, at least at the time I bought it, does not indicate the audio functionality (and other important functionality) is only available in IE.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: RR
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a camera that only covers one direction this is it. Also, if you want/need this to always have IR on, this is it. You cannot turn the IR off and the power light is on the front.... great night light. We use it in one of our rooms to just monitor for movement.

Reviews.Title: Green turns to be pinkish color, why?
Reviews.Author: Shaojie Gong
Reviews.Content: Overall not bad cam, but why the green color turns to be pink? it works indoor with light green, but once pointing to a tree at backyard or front yard, or anything deeper green the color seems reverted and become sort of pink, I missed the package return window, now I have to keep it.bottom line is it is working good to recognize human face.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: James Gray
Reviews.Content: I got this for my babys room.  Wanted something i could setup with my android and this did the trick.  I am able to watch the baby and hear him over the internet from anywhere.  I am very pleased with this product.  The only negitive thing that I have about it is that at the sound can cut in and out at times.

Reviews.Title: Works fine...not for amatuers
Reviews.Author: D. BYRD
Reviews.Content: I have been using IP cameras for years. I have 9 setup around my house using BlueIris for the software. All IP cameras are similar in their setup....meaning it takes a little networking knowledge to setup. Once set up they are like any other appliance...they simply run.I bought this to replace another FOSCAM that suddenly died after 1 year 10 months. Thankfully I used an AMEX and was refunded the original purchase price (AMEX doubles the basic warranty!). This camera is cheaper...and provides a better picture. Setup for me was all of 7 minutes from box open to me mounting it on the wall.

Reviews.Title: Too much headache.
Reviews.Author: The Count
Reviews.Content: The device hat a very short stay at my home, one night. I have 20 years computing and networking experience but was unable to get the cam to email pictures when the motion sensor trips. The problem may be that the device does not support SMTP servers that use SSL, buts thats what just about EVERY provider uses, so no Gmail, AOL, Hotmail, Live, etc etc etc. Of course, if this is a feature you dont plan on using you may be fine. At least the first day the device did upload pics to my ftp server and I was able to see live video on my iphone. The next day after a cam reboot (switching to another room) the green light just blinked fast and that was it. From this point on it only worked with the Cat 5 cable... well, back it goes and I am giving a Dlink a try...It appears that even the much more expensive cam like those from Panasonic give users a fair share of headaches.

Reviews.Title: Terrible video quality and constant wi-fi drops.
Reviews.Author: Txawj Foom
Reviews.Content: Returning this unit after 13 days of usage.PROS* Low-cost entry into WiFi/IP camera.* Nice, aesthetic design.* Easy to setup.* Easily configured for use with Blue Iris.* Good size (about the size of a computer mouse)* Very light* Respectable viewing angle.Had it set up in under 10 minutes. This included scrounging around for my drill driver and a couple of wood screws.CONS* WiFi signal on this camera is horrible. Interfered with my router's WiFi signal such that, where I once had a strong signal, I now had weak wifi signals as experienced via other devices like iPad, iPods, and evaluated by inSSIDer. Constant drops. Extremely low bandwidth which resulted in really poor video frame rate. All of this with the cam installed less than 12ft from the router (unfinished basement).* Ethernet cable hookup fared no better. Still poor signal and low frame rate (per Blue Iris).* While picture of stationary objects were as expected for camera of this resolution depth, moving objects showed up blurry and with a lot of ghosting.Hard reset had no effect.Wasn't expecting much but horrible wifi connection plus unacceptable interference with router signal along with poor video capture (unrecognizable moving objects) make this camera a poor alternative to a $15 motion sensor alarm Driveway Patrol Sensor and Receiver Kit!

Reviews.Title: it works for what I needed
Reviews.Author: Ross Hart "--ross"
Reviews.Content: my daughter is in a wheelchair in a basement apartment of our house. She cannot see when her para-transit bus arrives and sometimes had to sit in the rain so she wouldn't miss it.  now she can watch on her phone or computer to see when it arrives.I wish there were a way to turn off the night vision IR. We have it in a window and at night the IR reflects from the window back into the camera obliterating the street view.

Reviews.Title: Tenvis Mini vs Foscam Mini
Reviews.Author: Kaio
Reviews.Content: I've been making the switch from Logitech WiLife to IP WiFi cams, and the transition has been great; should have done it long ago.  So I've been adding more cams to our system, and decided I wanted one in our garage, so it has to pick up a solid signal through a couple plaster walls, and a thick garage door.  Given the environment, I knew I'd be pushing the limits of any WiFi cam, and on top of that, the cam needed to be compact. So I decided to try out the Tenvis Mini319w and the Foscam FI8909W.  Here's how they stacked up:> WiFi RangeTenvis - When I tested the cam in the house, all was fine.  But once it got into the garage and had to push through all the geographic obstacles, Tenvis had spotty reception at best. The video was stop-motion, and lost signal every few seconds.  Clearly, the issue is the barely 1" tall antenna; it's just too small to break through and hold a signal.Foscam - The Foscam yielded similar results; pitch perfect in the house, and spotty in the garage.  At this point, one might think this particular setup just isn't possible; the conditions are just too difficult.Just for kicks - I put both my Tenvis JPT3815W and Foscam FI8910W) pan & tilt cams into the garage, and they also had a hard time staying connected at that range, and under those conditions.  Which leads me to the one area where Foscam Mini is truly superior to Tenvis Mini...> Replaceable AntennaTenvis - has a stationary, non-replaceable antenna.  To make matters worse, it only extends about 1" above the camera housing; fine if your cam isn't far from your router, but downright terrible if the signal has to reach through any walls or obstructions.Foscam - some genius over at Foscam realized that, just because you want a compact cam, doesn't mean you shouldn't be able to replace the antenna. So I got myself a couple WIFI 10 dBi 2.4GHz Antennas, and voila -- my Foscam mini is now mounted in the garage and works flawlessly.  One antenna went on my router, the other went on my Foscam mini.**Note** - Foscam uses male antenna connectors.  I didn't realize this until after I bought 2 antennas with female connectors.  So I grabbed some old cable TV wire, clipped off a 3/8" sliver of copper, filed it down to fit, and gently inserted it into the antenna's female connector.  Then I just connected the newly modified antenna to my Foscam mini -- presto -- instant Foscam compatible antenna for less than 5 bucks.> Image QualitySetting WiFi range aside, both cams have equally nice video; crisp, clean, good focus.> LensFoscam = 67°Tenvis = 57°That 10° advantage for Foscam means it has a slightly wider viewable area than Tenvis.  The focal lengths appear to be the same on both; about 2cm - infinity.> IR LEDsTenvis = 21Foscam = 5Clearly the Tenvis has better night vision as a result.  But neither cam has the ability to turn OFF the LEDs manually.  Given how my cam is mounted, I really needed to be able to turn off those LEDs manually.  Since there's no way to do that under each cam's current firmware version, I just taped off all the LEDs on both cams with electrical tape.  I also taped off all visible markings and power indicators so the cams were just little black boxes with a lens.  It just makes them more stealth, plus, where I mounted the cams was causing the IRs to just blow out the video to white, since the IRs were bouncing back into the lens.  This is not a design flaw, it's just how things worked out with the way I needed the cams mounted.  Under normal conditions, the night vision works fine on both cams.  I have plenty of external lighting outside the garage, so the IR LEDs just weren't necessary in my setup.  The video from both cams look good at night, with or without the IRs functioning.  But keep in mind, you will need a minimal source of light elsewhere, if you blackout the LEDs like I did.> Software & InterfaceFoscam has it all over Tenvis in this department.  I have 2 different Tenvis cams, and the software on both is very crude and rudimentary.  It works fine, it just looks like it was programmed back in the 90's.  Foscam's interface, however, is pleasing to the eye, well laid out, straightforward, and very easy to use.  There's just no comparison; Foscam wins, hands-down.> SizeTenvis is basically 3.5" square.  Foscam is about 2.5" x 3.5"  For my purposes, the shape and housing of Foscam fit better where I was mounting it.> Camera MountBoth Tenvis and Foscam suck in this department.  Foscam actually has great quality mounts for all their standard PTZ cams, but the one for this mini version just wouldn't stay in place; the ball joint kept sliding one way or another and wouldn't stay put, no matter how hard I tightened it. Just the weight of the cam alone was enough to make the mount drift out of alignment.  Garbage.Tenvis' mount is also crap. The one for this mini cracked with the first turn of the camera screw, rendering it useless.  And this seems to be a running theme with Tenvis, because their mount for my standard PTZ cam is equally crap.> Customer ServiceTenvis' customer service is iffy.  They seemed friendly enough, but there's definitely a language barrier, coupled with the time difference to China, and the fact that all communication is happening via email, and it all adds up to a tedious experience.I haven't had the need to call Foscam or use their customer service, in part because their User Interface is so good, that I don't feel the need for additional guidance. But I can say that, Foscam appears to have offices in Texas, and when I submitted my Best Offers to them on a popular auction site, both were accepted, and all email communique was highly professional and friendly. So if I ever run into problems, I feel more confident working with Foscam than Tenvis.> ConfigThese cams are not for beginners or the tech-phobic.  You need some knowledge of routing, WiFi, port forwarding and IP addresses to make these cams work.  It's nothing hard.  In fact, I never really read the instructions for any of them; I just jumped in and got the cams going on my system within 15 minutes.  The fine tuning and tweaking, naturally, took much longer.  But the initial setup is pretty easy.> A Word About Blue IrisI recently upgraded to Foscam Blue Iris Professional and it's a fantastic security cam suite.  Very easy to use, and you can control and tweak pretty much anything.  Works with most every IP cam, webcam, and even camcorders out there.  Very nice upgrade, particularly coming from Logitech WiLife, which was just crap.Bottom Line -- Tenvis mini is ok, if you don't mind the wonky interface, and your environment is pretty clean.  The video quality is good, provided you can maintain a reliable signal.  But the short antenna on the Tenvis mini ensures you're not getting very far from your router with it.  Foscam, with its replaceable antenna, is the way to go if your environment is more challenging.  Plus the user interface and customer service is just better than Tenvis.  I'd still buy another Tenvis if I needed a budget cam.  But if there's a deal to be had on a Foscam, I'll grab that one over Tenvis every time. IMO, Foscam is just better, no matter what style cam you're getting.  I sent back the Tenvis mini and kept the Foscam.  It's going strong as we speak, mounted in my garage with that long-range antenna.  Happy! ;oD

Reviews.Title: Two-way audio monitoring is tricky
Reviews.Author: Pat Pending
Reviews.Content: The listing clearly says "Two-way audio monitoring", but I could not find any way to do it in Internet Explorer. I tried to chat and call Foscam, but no one was home. Puzzled, I decided to try Firefox, and I was able to hear the audio. With TinyCAM Pro (android app) I was able to get the two way audio to work. Bottom line, you will have to use Firefox (with VLC plugin) or a web cam app on andriod to use the mic & speaker in the camera. For the price, this is a good little IP camera.

Reviews.Title: Less Cost but less features
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is OK but after using the other Foscam products I found that for a few dollars more you could have a cam that rotated etc.

Reviews.Title: Decent quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Blake McJunkin
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with camera overall.  It does not have great resolution or dynamic range, but does the job.  I placed mine at my front door under my covered porch.  We will see how it holds up outdoors, but it recieved no sun or rain where it is so it should be fine.  The exposure on this camera seems a bit quirky at first but you get used to it.  In my location I find that during the day the image is exposed correctly but when the night comes the image overall is dim until something moves in front of the IR lights then it is properly exposed.  It is just something you have to get used to, but it does have an autoexposure unlike other foscam reviews I read.  Once you find a happy compromise for the brightness and contrast settings you can leave them alone and do not have to change them twice a day as someone wrote.  The camera I recieved has the latest 11.40.2.46 firmware that does support TLS in the mail settings so I can use gmail.  I am not sure but I believe there is an older firmware that is not upgradable and does not support secure email servers.  I cannot comment on the wireless stability since I ran a cable to my location, but I would expect it to drop from time to time since it is wireless which is why I ran a cable.Probably my biggest disappointment about this camera is I wanted to recieve instant notification when motion was detected since they advertise that function, but when I set it up I realized that it records motion for 60 seconds then sends 6 snapshots in the email.  It still is useful but I wanted a notification before someone even hit the door bell.  Oh well I guess I was asking a lot.  If you use blue iris you can setup the make and break times for motion to be short and it is almost instant so that is what I am going to do.  I just wanted the firmware to handle it so it would always be supervising the front door incase the computer running blue iris shutdown.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8909W
Reviews.Author: kamazon
Reviews.Content: The camera is pretty good for the price, and gets the job done.  The picture quality is decent for a wi-fi camera in this price range.  However, I wish Foscam made a hi-def version of this wi-fi camera.  i.e. A smaller hi-def camera without the pan, tilt, zoom and with a 67 degree viewing angle.Things I would like to see:1. An option to turn off the power LED, similar to the option to turn off the network LED.  A piece of electrical tape over the LED gets the job done.2. An option to turn off the IR LEDs.  Some of the other Foscam models do provide this capability.3. A longer power cord included.

Reviews.Title: Updated 10/1/13:  These cameras are junk and the software is even worse
Reviews.Author: EZ
Reviews.Content: Update 10/1/13:  Rating lowered from 3 stars to 1 star.  Of the 3 cameras I bought, two have ceased to function.  I cannot connect to them anymore and they are essentially bricks.  The included software to help find the cameras no longer finds them.  Utter pieces of crap.  DO NOT BUY!!!----------------------------PROS:  Camera works great, IR at night was better than I expected, and field of view has a pretty decent angle.  Wifi setup was pretty simple as long as you can find the IP address.CONS:  Software for this is crap and this seems to be the big downfall of all these webcams that rely on ActiveX.  Even 3rd party software, which offers more options and slightly better usability, are not that great unless you're willing to shell out big bucks for pro solutions.  The best consumer option I've found for Windows OS is Blue Iris or ispyconnect.  Blue Iris is a paid solution while ispyconnect is open source free software w/ an optional  subscription that unlocks extra features.If you're a Mac OSX user, I hope you don't mind silence because there's no solution I've found thus far that has working audio (both from camera and talkback).  Oddly enough, the best software I've seen for these cameras is on iOS.  I've been using Foscam Pro app [...] made by RobotoApps lately and have been happy with it as a remote viewing solution.In general, you'll need to have some basic networking knowledge and be comfortable tweaking settings on your router if you ever hope to be able to view your camera outside of your home network.  If this sounds at all daunting and you have $$ to burn, do yourself a favor...forgo the frustration and go buy a  DropCam w/ subscription.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed.
Reviews.Author: M. W. Long "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I bought this, along with 4 of the FI8910W cams to cover my townhouse. The FI8910W cams are well worth the money. This one is not. It has trouble staying connected over wireless and is very slow when it is connected. Its picture quality is poor in comparison to the other cams. The green leaves outside of the front window are pink according to it. An FI8910W in the same location has no problems and the leaves are green! I sent this one back and am using the FI8910W instead. For a price difference of around $35.00 or so, I feel much happier with the FI8910W.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Economical Price
Reviews.Author: Phast Phil "Phast Phil"
Reviews.Content: This is my THIRD camera in the FOSCAM FI89xxW Series of IP cameras.  I have two of the FI8910 pan/tilt models and one FI8909W.  They all use the same software, so getting to understand the basic setup is easily applied to the other cameras including the NON P/T FI8909W.  For the most part, these cameras work very well, even in MINIMAL LIGHT at night with the built in IR LED's.  There is a fair amount of barrel distortion from the inexpensive wide angle lens, but that is to be expected for a camera that sells for $100 or less. This is after all a security camera.I use the MOTION Detector and email options, and they work very well, once you figure out how to set it up.  The TEST email button is great to check settings prior to putting it ONLINE.  The only feature I wish these cameras had is a adjustable/selective motion alarm window rather than relying on the whole frame.....light changes in the morning and evening cause the camera to send erroneous ALARMS due to the light change.  I've tried lowering the sensitivity, but the problem is that it detects the whole frame, rather than selectively isolating a small area, like just an entry door.  Maybe an upcoming firmware revision will include this feature.The FTP feature works as advertised and was easy to setup, once you know the coordinates of your FTP server.If you are NOT a techie kind of person, you might enlist the help of someone who is....as the alarm, FTP settings and IP addresses can be confusing to someone not immersed in this on a daily basis.  Also, if you are on an ISP that changes your IP address often, you MUST subscribe to a Dynamic IP service....there apparently are no more FREE services, so figure a few $$ a month so you can get logged into your camera from outside your home/office, through the Internet - if that is what you want it for.  If you only use these cameras within the network of your home/office, NO DYNAMIC IP service is needed.  I do suggest once you setup the wireless IP address you go into your router and convert THAT dynamic IP address to a static IP, so it won't change if you unplug or loose power to your camera.  BTW, if you only want to send email alarm notification and snapshots during the alarm (settable) you do NOT need an dynamic IP service, the camera will send the email regardless of what IP address your WAN address is. These cameras require a DHCP IP address FIRST to setup and configure the camera via a wired LAN connection.  You can then assign the camera to a static IP and or PORT setting and use wireless if desired.  Again, if this is all confusing, you really need a techie person....maybe a 15 year old kid down the block could help.... LOL.BTW, I see Foscam now has a new series of camera with HD resolution (720P) rather than SD resolution (480i).  Not sure if this is really a great advantage for a security camera.  The pictures with the SD resolution are very good and easy to identify an object or persons within the frame of interest.  If I buy one of those new cameras, I'll update my review.

Reviews.Title: Hit or miss?
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: I tried putting this in a window that is next to my front door.  The entry room to my house is nothing but open space and the stairs are off to the side.  I have a wireless router at the top of my stair case.  I would guess that a straight line distance from the window to the top of the stairs is around 40ft (with no walls).  But, this camera would not connect with my router at this distance.Other than the poor wifi range, the camera is great for the price range.  I was planning to use it to monitor who comes up to my front door and to have it email me whenever it detects motion.Will have to look for an antenna/range extender... or, a different camera.*UPDATEI updated my original review, because I thought I had resolved my wifi issues...  Seems that the wifi connectivity (at longer distances) is spotty.  After having read some information on other forums and postings, I went into the setup of the camera to update the sensitivity settings for motion detection.  I changed the settings and rebooted the camera.  Now, it doesn't connect wirelessly at the distance I want it to.  Works fine when the camera is close to the router, but what good is that.

Reviews.Title: Took me 3 days to setup completely.
Reviews.Author: Hughes Lion
Reviews.Content: Too difficult to set up. If you are not a computer genius forget about it. Follow the video setup instruction on the cd. It's better than the booklet.

Reviews.Title: Wireless didn't work properly
Reviews.Author: Andrew Blaine
Reviews.Content: I just received this unit and was really excited to use it wirelessly. I noticed that out of the box, it didn't find my wireless when I hit scan (or that of my neighbors). I upgraded both firmware (system and webgui) and still no result. Sent it back and ordered another, hopefully the second one will work.

Reviews.Title: So Good I Bought Three Of Them!!
Reviews.Author: SamTheMan
Reviews.Content: This IP camera is perfect. Its cheap, reliable, easy to set-up and durable. Allow me expand each point that I just made:Cheap: At $55.00 (with free two day shipping for prime members) you can't beat it. Anywhere. It even has a warranty!Reliable: I have two running 24/7/365, they have never dropped their connection and maintain a high frame rate (20FPS).Easy to set-up: Follow the instructions in the guide they give you. First you turn it on and plug it in, then you use the software they give you to find its IP Address. Then your browser takes over. It supports activeX (IE) AND it has sever push mode for FireFox! Server push mode is much better then activeX. It also has a mobile viewer for your phone. Using the settings on the camera's webpage you can toggle how it connects (via LAN or WIFI) and what network it uses. It takes about 5mins from start to finish to set-up this camera. They also send you a video tutorial CD. You don't need to watch it but if you want a comical Japanese to English translation then I suggest you watch it. Its got bad lip syncing and everything. Like a bad Japanese movie.Durable: Its very sturdy and has a metal base complete with mounting equipment. The camera can also withstand falls, as I found that out first hand when I mounted it improperly. The base is also extremely balanced, and the camera can fully stand up on its own with out any mounting or screwing down (which is perfect for tables and temporary positions).I love this camera. I bought three of them to complete my home security system. Of course its native software sucks! Your not paying for the software, your paying for the camera! You obviously have to use it with good third party software to really take advantage of it. I use my camera with ISPY CONNECT. Its a wonderful FREE program complete with motion tracking, email alerts, it runs programs and plays sounds on alerts, it has facial recognition, image recognition, everything. You can connect as many cameras as you want to it and it even has a handy wizard to help you set everything up. You can even connect to their severs (for a small monthly fee)so you can stream the cameras to any device in the world! Its amazing!You can use these cameras and free third party software to create an amazing security system that blows away anything that you can buy else where. And its totally affordable. 5 stars all the way.

Reviews.Title: Best wireless remote cam for the money
Reviews.Author: G. Feathers
Reviews.Content: Installation was a breeze, setup was challenging, but the overall resolution and video quality are AMAZING for the money! Works great with the free "CamViewer" App for iPad/iPhone!

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: L. LE
Reviews.Content: night vision: checkworks: checkgreat price: checki'd give it 6 stars if somehow they would work through a window too. i know night vision can't work through windows so it's absolutely no fault to Foscam :)

Reviews.Title: Don't get it if you want wireless!
Reviews.Author: BruceB
Reviews.Content: After having two of the bigger Foscam cameras work fine in their applications, I thought this would be good for an application where I wanted smaller.  Wrong!  Even though I have the other two Foscam cameras all set up and working wirelessly, I cannot for the life of me get this one to go wireless.  The only reason I haven't returned it is because I can use it where I want it with a cord, so I am just keeping it.  But if I had to go wireless, it would have been returned by now.UPDATE - I have now decided to return the camera, because I decided I don't need to spend the money for a wireless cam when I have to use the wire anyway.

Reviews.Title: I had to return this!
Reviews.Author: Sal Mortilla
Reviews.Content: It seemed to work good for a few hours with my desktop (windows 8) then would not connect.The android app could not find or connect no matter how hard I tried .for me it is a one star but that's not saying others do not have good luck with this.

Reviews.Title: Works Well
Reviews.Author: Paula A. Regan
Reviews.Content: This camera has worked well, though it did lose it's config suddenly at least once for no apparent reason. Otherwise it's exactly as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Worked very well for what what I bought them for.
Reviews.Author: A User
Reviews.Content: Did the job, caught the burgler.So this site requires me to babble on an on about the product. I just like getting to the point.

Reviews.Title: as advertised
Reviews.Author: Glenn Linderman
Reviews.Content: Works, but indoor use really means that, the IR LEDs reflect off the glass, so you can't expect to point this out the window at night.

Reviews.Title: Great except for WIFI range
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: I like this camera but the WIFI range is not very good.  Its located not that far from the WIFI base and it has trouble keeping a reliable connection.  Other than the connection the product is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Caveat emptor. This thing was junk.
Reviews.Author: Jason A. Miller
Reviews.Content: Nice picture (day & night) and simple configuration made this a very decent cam for the money. Too bad it only lasted about 3 months before failing. The unit was plugged into a decent surge protector but simply would not "boot" after moving it to a new location. I have a 3 year old cheap D-Link camera (similar specs) which has been OUTSIDE in a covered position and is still working.. and that's through the seasons here in the NE. I babied this Foscam indoors and it still failed.Forget getting this thing repaired under warranty - I felt like I was in a hedge maze trying to find the right number to call.I gave the camera 2 stars instead of one because it really was a nice little camera until it failed. It's possible I just got a lemon, but my online research indicates it's a common occurrence.Sorry, Foscam, I'm going elsewhere for my camera needs.

Reviews.Title: Very poor wireless reception
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Araujo "korsario"
Reviews.Content: Be aware!, wireless is very poor. Inclusive I upgrade the antenna but same result. You have to place your camera very close to wireless source to have a decent working softWARE. other foscam camera model work better tan this one.

Reviews.Title: decent camera but refurb problems and wireless interference probs!
Reviews.Author: 21farms "21farms"
Reviews.Content: i have 3 wireless IP cameras in my house: one foscam, one D-link and a loftek. i got them all a little over two years ago. in that time, i've been through two lofteks and decided stay away from them even though they're customer service was very responsive and helpful. i opted for this fixed-position foscam as a replacement and thought i'd save a few bucks by getting a refurbished one. well, the first one arrived and it looked new...the problem was, it would power on but refused to connect to my network. i tried it on 2 different routers, a hub and a switch with no luck so i returned it and ordered another one. when the second one arrived and i opened the box, i was shocked to find just the camera body, the antenna and the power adapter...no instruction manual, no CD, and, most importantly, no mounting stand! still, i wanted to make sure it worked so i set it up and it worked. set-up is a royal PITA. the foscam instructions which i downloaded from their website are horrendous and the built-in DDNS address did not work so i resorted to assigning it to my dyndns.org host which finally gave me wireless connectivity. luckily, i am somewhat experienced with networks and IP cameras or i never would have figured it out. foscam claims 7 meters of IR range but it is definitely less than my other cameras that claim about the same range. so, in summary, the FI8909W is a good camera,especially for the price, but i'd highly recommend buying a new one to avoid any potential refurb hassles like i'm dealing with. it took me such a long time to get the camera properly setup and configured that i don't want it send it back for a replacement just to get the stand so i just emailed foscam support and asked them to send me one. we shall see...october 7 update: foscam support emailed me back the very next day asking for a copy of my invoice and sent out the missing piece the next day. i received it just two days later. excellent customer service.october 11 update: shortly after installing the FI8909W, our remotes for our garage door starting acting really squirrelly, refusing to open or close the garage door 95% of the time. i then ran a cat-5 cable directly to the camera and disabled the wireless in the web interface and removed the antenna yet the problem persisted. i performed a series of tests: unplug the camera's power, the garage door openers work fine. plug in the camera, the garage door openers stop working. repeated over and over again with same result. i finally put my FI8918W in the same spot (hard-wired connection) and everything works fine. so, my words of caution: WATCH OUT FOR WIRELESS INTERFERENCE WITH THE FI8909W!

Reviews.Title: Very Dissapointing Quality
Reviews.Author: Steve Bauer
Reviews.Content: This camera has the worst color rendering of any camera I have used.It has the appearance of night mode in full daylight.Setup is primitive almost DOS like interface.The specs were promising, but  I am returning it and will purchase another D-Link instead.

Reviews.Title: Awful Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Schlosburg
Reviews.Content: I really wish the camera was anywhere close to the quality of the software, but it's not. Took me one minute to get it set up on my wireless network, but the actual camera and physical build quality are terrible. There is a large dead spot on one side of the image. The photocell is not set in the socket straight, causing the IR lights come on even during the day, which gives the image a horrible lack of color. The stand is barely functional and has an extremely limited range of motion. If I had known this device would be of such a low quality I never would have ordered it.

Reviews.Title: motion images/video is very dissappointing
Reviews.Author: for your consideration
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I immediately updated the firmware to the latest based on my research prior to my purchase. The update process was flawless (make sure to do it from a wired connection). The configuration process was relatively easy as well. The "IP Camera Tool" software (included with the camera) used to locate the camera(s) on the network works very well and web browser interaction (SeaMonkey, Firefox, and Internet Explorer) worked equally as well (both wired and wireless).The Foscam forums have a wealth of helpful information. I especially appreciated the topic(s) discussing how to disable the embedded My.Foscam.org DDNS setting in the firmware configuration. This is otherwise not configurable through the normal user interface (UI). Really, must this be a default with the inability to simply disable it? The not-so-savvy users could open the cam for full viewing by the general public if they are not careful. Read more about this in the post at: [...]Update: Amazon will not post the link, so just go to the Foscam forum and search for "Security Concern with MyFoscam.org".As for the image quality, the clearest can be acquired at 320x240 (rather small). The only other option is 640x480 which is a bit grainy. Static images are easily recognizable, even at night with the infra-red LEDs lighting the scene. However, motion video at either of these resolutions leaves a lot to be desired. Motion is very blurry and infrequently identifiable. In my experience with these cameras and other multiple Foscam's I bought here (FI8910W and FI8905W), I found this to be the case with video and snapshot stills when motion is in the scene. Basically, if you know who/what it is, then you can probably identify it, but good luck with an unexpected/uninvited guest. I believe this to be an inherent weakness in the camera design and a detriment when using these for home surveillance.Another note on the infra-red LEDs: they emit a red glow in the dark or low-light environments. Therefore, they are not really suited for concealment and can easily be spotted.  They also have other bright power and network activity LEDs on them as well.  While the network LED can be shut off in the software, the power LED cannot. With these on the front they happily announce their presence to any would-be intruder (day or night - which I realize is moot given the aforementioned red-glow).As for the other CMS (Central Management Software) software included with the camera(s), it does work but it is not without its own quirks. -- For one thing, CMS *MUST* be run with *Administrator* privileges in Windows (I use Win7 Pro). Otherwise, it cannot be properly configured for use with the cameras. So, right-mouse-click the icon and select "Run as administrator". This is a software design flaw which could have been overcome by incorporating other methods. -- Once configured, I found CMS to be clunky and sluggish when controlling cameras. I had eight of them setup and it was painful to remotely operate them. With two or three configured it was more manageable. And I am running this on a very powerful Intel-based core-i7 PC at 3.5GHz!In the end, I am disappointed with my investment and may opt to return/replace these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Very nice picture and clarity for the price!!!
Reviews.Author: Newby
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera that works very well in all different light scenarios. The one big difference between this one and the other Foscams is it does not tilt or pan so it is aimed the way you have it mounted and aimed but definitely worth it if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Great Stuff!!!
Reviews.Author: Wap
Reviews.Content: I am using this camera as the eye of a robot that I'm building. Setup is a breeze (taking me only about 8 min), and there is very little lag time (great for my purposes). The lag that I am getting from the networks that I've used it on is about 25-100ms, it really depends on the speed of your network. I am glad that I chose this camera for my project, and am thoroughly impressed with its performance at this price-point!

Reviews.Title: Great IP camera at low price
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Salazar O.
Reviews.Content: This is my second foscam and I'm proud of it. Works great. I haven't complaints. Set up is easy and I was lucky to receive a new version with WIFI-n support.

Reviews.Title: I love these cameras
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these over a year ago, and they've been great.  This latest purchase appears to be an updated version of the hardware, but almost unnoticeable.  They do make better cameras (higher res and better color), but for the price, these are great.  To be fully satisfied, you really need to purchase cam software such as "Blue Iris."  You can really unlock the potential of these cameras by buying good software to accompany them.  My Blue Iris with these cameras allows me to capture video on motion detection, mask out pesky trees blowing in the wind, and it sends me a 10 sec video clip via email when triggered.  It also buffers up several frames in advance so you don't miss the action... without the buffer, your camera will trigger via motion detection too late, and it will miss the action.  With Blue Iris, I can view in remotely to see what's going on via web page.  Without good software, the camera is probably not going to amaze you.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: I set this camera up outside under my covered patio. it seems to be working great so far.. color are a little off but who cares. Ive got the motion "sensibility" set up at 5 and it still sends me an email when there is the slightest change in light outside. like if a cloud passes over or something. ive turned the "sensibility" down to 3 and im going to see how that works. hopefully i wont get 25 motion alarms throughout the day because a bug flew in front of the camera or a cloud went by. other than that it's been great. setup was easy once you've done it once on another camera by foscam. and the install was a breeze..

Reviews.Title: Sharp image and quality camera
Reviews.Author: twitte
Reviews.Content: This Foscam is well made and gives a quality/sharp image.  So far I'm very happy with the camera.  All my other cameras are Foscam (different model) and they work very well too.  Good price for a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Works well, good price
Reviews.Author: Leonardo Faoro
Reviews.Content: I bought this as the first camera to monitor my home. It has worked really well so far. The mounting support is really good, and comes with screws. As for the software, the camera can be tricky to setup. I consider myself competent to configure this, and it still took me a good 30 mins to set it up, and connect it with the software I am using for monitoring (iSpy, for Windows). I still have to set up port forwarding so I can access images when I'm away.This is a good choice if you're looking for a cheap, no-frills IR enhanced wireless camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Litte Camera
Reviews.Author: Mike M. M. Net
Reviews.Content: I have had this over 6 months and it is working very well. I use it to watch my dogs at home on EVO and Glaxy Tab using Tiny Camer software from the market.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Good Price
Reviews.Author: James Valentine
Reviews.Content: This camera is a really neat way to extend your home monitoring without breaking the bank. It works well as a standalone solution or with monitoring software, and it is really nice that all the functionality can be accessed on the web page hosted by the device. The instructions for set up are not well translated, and it took me too many attempts to figure out that I needed to wait an additional 30 seconds for the camera to join an encrypted wireless network. Another reviewer mentioned receiving the wrong product, which I did not experience (seller was SA for me).

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Easy set up and use. It comes with its own DNS. Works nice. Something we all need in this crazy world we live in.

Reviews.Title: works better than motorized unit
Reviews.Author: Margaret J. Lynne
Reviews.Content: I bought several of the motorized versions from foscam but they all had the same problem which I described in my reviews.  when they get a power glitch, they point up.  this one works much better.  no problems on power glitches or brown outs.  also this one has an adjustable focal length so you can get a much clearer picture a single point of focus.  works fine detecting motion and sending me emails.  could never get any of the foscam cameras to cross a fire wall of my routers so I could control them remotely.  focam has some directions on how you might do this but it is very very complex and not very reliable (and I'm a techie) so I don't use it.

Reviews.Title: Attention: hidden fees!!
Reviews.Author: Brandalyn
Reviews.Content: So my wife bought it based on a recommendation from a friend - turns out this is not only one of the most consumer "unfriendly" products I have seen in a very long time but also unlawful to sell in its current configuration. I am guessing the owner's manual was written by a Chinese engineer with broken English, the consumer experience installing this product was terrible. I finally managed but only because I have some networking experience. On page 25 of the owner's manual (they call it a quick start guide which is cynical at best...), without context and at a random spot you get to read (I quote: "Foscam domain name is free for three years, three years later, if you want to continue using the account, you need to pay for it."). Really? So you are telling me after all this effort and after selling me on the box with "control anywhere, anytime" slogans that I will have to pay a remote service fee in three years? Wow. Not only is this unlawful and considered false advertising in this country, it is simply unethical and deceptive, considering remote accessibility is the main selling point of this product.

Reviews.Title: outstanding product for the price
Reviews.Author: rk
Reviews.Content: Very happy with it. It has lots of features, very configurable and stable as a rock (been running about 2 months without twitching)

Reviews.Title: 4th one now
Reviews.Author: Tmedic
Reviews.Content: and now my set is complete. great products works just fine. great customer service from foscam us and calvin. this is a must buy. i recommend the 8910.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: pete
Reviews.Content: Product worked wireless  out of the box.Had trouble accessing from remote but received excellent support from Foscam tech support and got it running quickly.Ryan at Foscam provided excellent service and was extemly helpfull in setup. Quick setup works well untill remote access at which time more explanation is needed.

Reviews.Title: Foscam
Reviews.Author: William Landers
Reviews.Content: Works well....and the camera is just right for the purpose for which i purchased it, and has the right wide lenses.Bill Landers

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Dwayne
Reviews.Content: Great customer service from Christina, very informative fast and efficient. Thanks for the great job. The cameras are working now. I like the feature where you can listen as well as send audio via the camera. Very unique - sleek. It can also be set to detect motion should you decide to use it as a security device and it will e-mail you pictures. Awesome product! I strongly recommend this camera. Please note the upgrades and the newer ones that allow you to control the angle etc.

Reviews.Title: Decent IP cam
Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: This is a decent IP camera. Easy to set up and use. Reasonable image quality, good range, decent nighttime performance. Bigger than I expected.I had this device up and running in just a few minutes. An inexpensive way to dip your toe into the IP camera world. If you've never owned an IP camera, this is a good way to start.

Reviews.Title: Foscam works, but not quite what i need.
Reviews.Author: Louis G. Baron "iblouie"
Reviews.Content: I got the Foscam to work and it does an adequate job, but just as with any, I assume, camera behind a window, the night lights make it moot. The camera works well in the daytime, and that is okay except for the reflection off the pool, causes a problem when the sun moves to the west. I had ordered some Wanscam Cameras that Pan and Tilt and are also wireless and they are more readily adaptable to the changing environment. I can move them around if the sun causes a glare problem.

Reviews.Title: damn good ip cam!
Reviews.Author: Chris Swiontek
Reviews.Content: GREAT! for adding to an existing i.p. cam system {shows up in ip camera tools clean}great rez and frame rate,and the wireless range is pretty impressive {if you actually have a decent router/not belkin or other cheap crap from walmart=)night vision is OK, not the best ive seen {05w foscams have the best}, but good for a 15x15 foot room or office}pretty small {good thing} and the BEST mounting bracket i have EVER seen come with a foscam {i have installed 1000s over the years}perfect "fixed position" ip cam, and have good angle view {3.6mm is actually what comes with it/pretty good/and is a 1/2" lense,witch you can get other mm just about anywhere. {i recomend a 2.1mm for very small rooms /less than 15'x15'}  if youre getting poor frame rates on wireless, you have a "ghetto router", spend a few buks and buy a "real one".  p.s. I am the Owner and Founder of Swan Technology Corp. U.S.A. ,and i Personally recommend this ip cam.other considerations for i.p cam setups:  o4w series foscam for outdoor short range setups {less than 50feet}  05w series foscam for outdoor LONG range setups {150-300feet /best night vision of ALL TIME!}  18w series foscam for INDOOR P/T {pan tilt} setups less than 50feet}  09w series foscam {this model here} for indoor "fixed position setups less than 50feetall these series cameras WILL work together on the same network ,and are EASY to port forward for remote view {over the enternet}great seller ,buy the way=)

Reviews.Title: Camera works OK but a used item masquerading as new
Reviews.Author: Joseph Tobolski
Reviews.Content: It works fine.  My big issue was the camera was the camera was obbiously used.  The CD was broken, there was non-default information in the setup (such as names, ports and password), and the cables weren't wrapped/tied correctly.  A reset took care of it, but very disappointed a used unit was sold as new.

Reviews.Title: Foscam purchase
Reviews.Author: AmazonFan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera and it was received defective. I attempted to plug it in and the plug is loose and will not stay in... it's unfortunately because I rarely have had any products received that didn't work.

Reviews.Title: 1 yr old
Reviews.Author: E. Rader
Reviews.Content: have it in kitchen window, works great no problems. Emails and see everything I need it to do will by another

Reviews.Title: Poor image, software is useless, won't work with other software I tried.
Reviews.Author: Stickman
Reviews.Content: The camera will only successfully work with Firefox.It will not run in MSIE because it wants to run an unsigned active x script.It will not work with my security software PSS 4.05.It will not work with my android phone using the gDMSS.The image is "soft" and seems to only have a manual focus.I bought a Logitech USB HD webcam for $50 that produces beautiful images and was a snap to install. So why can't we get the same thing in an IP camera?Foscam lost me as a customer and we spend thousands of dollars a year on security video cameras.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: kathy lane
Reviews.Content: the lady who help me was very nice and did it in a timely fashion I would give her a 10 I love the camera and will tell my friends and family

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Andrea's princess account
Reviews.Content: Thanks Andrew for such awesome support service.  You did a great job with helping me set up my Camera's and walk me through on how to record.  I purchased 4 camera's and needed support for all four and Andrew at foscam was great in helping me.Thanks alotAndrea

Reviews.Title: Foscam f18910w / Windows 7 / No Audio / MAC issues
Reviews.Author: Patrick123r45
Reviews.Content: All, I would not buy a Foscam camera model f18910w. It doesn't work with windows 7 out of the box??? Come on Foscam what were you thinking? Not to mention it's not campatable with a MAC???? Horrible horrble horrble.Search "Foscam no audio" if you don't believe me.Patrick

Reviews.Title: Bad out of the box Not the real thing
Reviews.Author: John L. Hughes
Reviews.Content: The camera was missing the antenna. They put a sticker over the hole.  It was sold as NEW but was used and broken. The Wi-Fi antenna was missing. The connector on the camera was missing and a sticker was over the hole to hide it. I will never order from them again. The Foscam web site warns about this camera. Beware they sell Junk.. Here is what the web site says "Warning: There are a large number of imitation/knockoff Foscam cameras being sold on Amazon, Ebay and other websites online. In addition, there are a number of merchants selling genuine Foscam cameras who do not provide adequate support or after-sales service to their customers, or require their customers to ship their genuine Foscam cameras back to China in order to receive a replacement or refund. This is a huge problem and the cause of much frustration on behalf of end users. " I got the good one at [...].

Reviews.Title: wonderful service
Reviews.Author: Minpin
Reviews.Content: they help to the fullest!!!! i cant beleive the great help they providepicture is great and i would recommend this product
